meanings.definition: To bring into or keep in equilibrium.
meanings.sent1: She carefully equilibrates the scales to make sure they are balanced.
meanings.sent2: The chef must equilibrate the flavors in the dish to create a harmonious taste.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to equilibrate the spinning plates on his head, but they kept falling off.
meanings.sent4: In life, we must constantly equilibrate our priorities to maintain a sense of balance.
meanings.sent5: The tightrope walker must equilibrate their body to stay upright on the thin rope.

meanings.sent1: He uses weights to equilibrate the seesaw so both sides are level.
meanings.sent2: Adding more fuel to the fire helps equilibrate the temperature inside the oven.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to equilibrate their study time with relaxation time for better focus.
meanings.sent4: The therapist helps her patients equilibrate their emotions during stressful situations.
meanings.sent5: The pilot must equilibrate the plane's altitude to ensure a smooth flight.

meanings.definition: To reach or maintain a state of equilibrium.
meanings.sent1: The ecosystem will equilibrate over time after the introduction of a new species.
meanings.sent2: It is important to equilibrate the temperature of the room before conducting the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The athlete needs to equilibrate their breathing to improve their performance.
meanings.sent4: The negotiators worked hard to equilibrate the terms of the agreement for both parties.
meanings.sent5: The financial market tends to equilibrate itself through supply and demand dynamics.
